article_title: We can lower healthcare costs by limiting the role of insurance
article_text:
Healthcare costs rose 5.3 percent in 2014, the first year under the Affordable Care Act

Insurance is a middleman driving up costs for routine care

Return insurance to its traditional role of covering only unpredictable, catastrophic expenses

article_metadata.title: We can lower healthcare costs by limiting the role of insurance | The Star-Telegram

og.description: The biggest challenges are those that require thinking outside the box — especially so when it comes to reducing healthcare spending in Texas.
